archetype_name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
name: Gochujang-Lime Grilled Tilapia with Charred Corn-Jalapeño Relish, Sesame Cabbage Slaw, and Sticky Rice
description: Hot, bold grilled tilapia glazed with gochujang-lime, served with a bright corn–jalapeño relish, crisp sesame cabbage slaw, and sticky rice. A Korean–Latin American mashup built from scratch with layered heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups sticky rice under cold water until it runs mostly clear; drain.
Pat dry 4 tilapia fillets with paper towels.
In a bowl, whisk gochujang, soy sauce, lime juice, garlic, sesame oil, olive oil, and a pinch of sugar for the fish glaze.
Toss tilapia with half of the glaze; reserve the other half for basting.
Shred cabbage (about 6 cups) and thinly slice spring onion (4).

In a bowl, whisk rice vinegar, a squeeze of lime, a pinch of sugar, salt, black pepper, and a pinch of chilli flakes for the slaw dressing; add cabbage and spring onion and toss. Set aside to lightly pickle.
Shuck corn (3 cobs) if needed and halve jalapenos (2) lengthwise; lightly oil with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
Chop coriander (a small handful) for finishing the relish.
Preheat outdoor grill to medium-high heat (clean and oil grates).
Set a lidded pot on the stovetop for rice.
cook_steps: Cook the rice on the stovetop: Add rinsed sticky rice and 2 cups water to the pot, bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender; rest off heat, covered, 10 minutes.
Grill the corn and jalapenos over direct heat, turning until corn is charred in spots and jalapenos blistered (6–8 minutes). Remove; cut kernels from cobs and finely chop jalapenos.
Make the corn–jalapeno relish: In a bowl, combine charred corn, chopped jalapenos, chopped coriander, a squeeze of lime, a drizzle of olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Set aside.
Grill the tilapia: Place marinated fillets on the hot grill. Cook 3–4 minutes per side, basting with reserved glaze, until opaque and lightly charred at edges.
Taste slaw and adjust with salt, black pepper, or more rice vinegar as needed. Sprinkle sesame seeds over the slaw and toss.
Fluff the sticky rice. Plate rice, top with a fillet, spoon over corn–jalapeno relish, and add a mound of sesame cabbage slaw. Serve hot.
